text: Iron(III) sulfide reacts with gaseous hydrogen chloride to produce iron(III) chloride and hydrogen sulfide. How much iron(III) sulfide would be required to react with 1.5 mol HCl?
How much CH4 remains after 10.0 g of CH4 reacts completely with 15.0 g of O2 according to the following equation? CH4(g) + 2 O2(g) → CO2(g) + 2 H2O(g)
A sample of 1.00 g of which compound contains the greatest number of atoms?
200.0 mL of aqueous nitric acid is mixed with 300.0 mL of 0.200 M Mg(NO3)2 solution to give a solution with a nitrate ion concentration of 0.500 M. What is the concentration of the nitric acid?

A student wishes to prepare a solution with a final concentration of Na+ = 0.50 M and a final concentration of HCO3– = 0.10 M by taking some NaOH and some trona (Na2CO3•NaHCO3•2H2O) and diluting with water to a final volume of 1.00 L. How much NaOH and trona are required?

options.D: A solution cannot be prepared with the desired concentrations of Na+ and HCO3– using only NaOH and trona.

text: As the concentration of an aqueous solution of sodium chloride increases from 1.0 M to 2.0 M, the values of which properties of the solution decrease? I. Density II. Freezing point
Which ion gives a green flame test?

The equilibrium constant for the formation of CoCl42-, a species that is blue in solution, is to be measured using a colorimeter. The colorimeter has wavelength settings of 470 nm (“blue”), 565 nm (“green”), and 635 nm (“red”) to use in the experiment. What is the best setting to use?

options.D: All settings would be equally suitable for the measurement.

text: A student is using a coffee-cup calorimeter to determine the enthalpy change of the endothermic reaction of two aqueous solutions. After both solutions are added to the cup, the student neglects to put the lid on the cup. This would cause the magnitude of the calculated ΔH° value to be:

options.A: too small, since some heat will escape out of the cup.
options.B: too large, since some heat will escape out of the cup.
options.C: too small, since the solution will absorb heat from the room.
options.D: too large, since the solution will absorb heat from the room.

text: Which substance produces a toxic and explosive gas when added to strong acids?
When aqueous ethanol is treated with an acidified solution of potassium dichromate, what is observed? I. Color change II. Gas evolution
Mixing which 0.1 M aqueous solutions results in formation of a colored precipitate?
Which liquid has the highest vapor pressure at 25 °C?

A sample of cyclohexane (C6H12, bp = 81 °C) is introduced into an evacuated container at 40 °C. One- third of the cyclohexane by mass is in the form of the liquid and two-thirds is in the form of the vapor. The volume of the container is then doubled, maintaining the temperature at 40 °C. What happens to the pressure as the volume is doubled?

options.D: The pressure decreases by a factor of two.

text: The normal boiling points of ammonia, water, and hydrogen fluoride increase in the order NH3 (bp = –33 °C) < HF (bp = 19 °C) < H2O (bp = 100 °C). What is the best explanation for this ordering?

options.A: H2O forms a greater number of hydrogen bonds per mol than NH3 or HF.
options.B: H2O forms stronger hydrogen bonds than NH3 or HF.
options.C: H2O has a larger dipole moment than NH3 or HF.
options.D: H2O has stronger London dispersion forces than NH3 or HF.

text: Which gas has the smallest molar volume at STP?
Which solid has the highest melting point?
A portion of the structure of solid potassium is shown below. In what type of unit cell are the atoms arranged?
What is the standard enthalpy of formation of C2H2(g)? ∆H°rxn, kJ mol-1 C2H2(g) + 5/2 O2(g) → 2CO2(g) + −1229.6 H2O(l) C(s, graphite) + O2(g) → CO2(g) −393.5 H2(g) + ½ O2(g) → H2O(l) −285.9
Which reaction occurs with the greatest increase in entropy?

A 2.00 g sample of solid RbClO4 (M = 184.92) is added to 100.0 g water, both initially at 23.00 °C, in a well- insulated container. The final temperature of the solution is 21.56 °C. What is ∆H°solution of RbClO4? (Assume that the specific heat capacity of the solution is the same as that of pure water and neglect the heat capacity of the insulated container.)
For a reaction studied over a wide temperature range, plots of ∆G°rxn/T vs. 1/T and of ∆G°rxn vs. T are linear. Which of the following must be independent of temperature? I. ∆G°rxn II. ∆H°rxn

Elemental tin forms two allotropes, white tin and gray tin. For the conversion of white tin to gray tin, ∆H° = –2.02 kJ mol-1 and ∆S° = –7.04 J mol-1 K-(1). Which statement best describes the stability of the two phases?

options.A: White tin is stable below 13.8 °C and gray tin is stable above this temperature.
options.B: Gray tin is stable below 13.8 °C and white tin is stable above this temperature.
options.C: White tin is stable below 0.3 °C and gray tin is stable above this temperature.
options.D: Gray tin is stable below 0.3 °C and white tin is stable above this temperature.

text: The plot of the natural logarithm of the molar solubility (S) of Ag2SO4 as a function of the reciprocal of the absolute temperature is shown below. What is ∆H°rxn for the following reaction? Ag2SO4(s) → 2 Ag+(aq) + SO42-(aq)
A reaction A 2 B was monitored over time. What is the average rate of disappearance of A between t = 0 and t = 10 minutes→?

An irreversible reaction A + B → products is monitored in buffered aqueous solution under conditions where [B] >> [A] by measuring the concentration of A as a function of time. The decay of A is found to be first-order under these conditions, with the half-life for its disappearance varying as shown. What is the rate law for this reaction? [B] pH Half-life for disappearance of A 0.100 M 1.00 120 s 0.200 M 1.00 60 s 0.200 M 1.50 190 s

The thermal decomposition of NOCl is a second-order process, and the rate constant k for the disappearance of NOCl at 160 °C is 0.0037 M-1 s-(1). What is the concentration of NOCl, initially at 0.043 M, after 20.0 minutes at 160 °C?
Bismuth-212 undergoes both α decay (35.9%) and β decay (64.1%) with an overall half-life of 60.6 minutes. What is its half-life for α decay?
The forward reaction is first-order in A. In a reaction initially containing only A at an initial concentration of [A]0, which plot will be linear over the course of the reaction?

The decomposition of nitryl chloride takes place according to the following equation: 2 NO2Cl(g) → 2 NO2(g) + Cl2(g) The following mechanism is proposed for this reaction: NO2Cl(g) NO2(g) + Cl(g) NO2Cl(g) + Cl(g) → NO2(g) + Cl2(g) Which rate laws are INCONSISTENT with the proposed mechanism, regardless of the relative rates of the two steps? I. Rate = k[NO2Cl] II. Rate = k[NO2Cl]2

options.D: Neither I nor II m after April 26, 2020

text: A sample of SO2Cl2 is introduced into a movable piston with the pressure maintained at 1.00 atm and the temperature at 450 K. The volume increases as the sulfuryl chloride equilibrates according to the following endothermic reaction: SO2Cl2(g) SO2(g) + Cl2(g) ∆H° > 0 Which changes would decrease the number of moles of SO2Cl2(g) present in the piston at equilibrium? In each case, the pressure is maintained at 1.00 atm. I. The temperature of the system is increased to 500 K. II. A sample of Ar(g) is injected into the piston.
In a solution whose ammonia concentration is 0.12 M, what percentage of the cadmium in solution is in the form of Cd(NH3)62+?
The Ksp of Sr(OH)2 is 2.0 × 10^-(3). What is the pH of a saturated solution of Sr(OH)2?

A gas X reacts reversibly and independently to form two different gases, Y and Z: X(g) Y(g) KY X(g) Z(g) KZ At a certain temperature⇄ , the time evolution of the pressures of the three ga⇄se s are shown. What is the equilibrium constant KY at this temperature? 5 4 3 2 1 0 Time O – Not for use as USNCO National Exam after April 26, 2020 )mta( erusserP laitraP P P PX Y Z

options.D: It cannot be determined because the system has not yet reached equilibrium.

text: When the following reaction is balanced under basic conditions, what is the ratio of the coefficients of Mn(OH)2(s) to MnO42-(aq)? Mn(OH)2(s) + MnO4–(aq) → MnO42-(aq)

What is the standard reduction potential for the reduction of permanganate ion to managanese dioxide in acidic solution? Half-Reaction Eº, V MnO4–(aq) + 8 H+(aq) + 5 e– → Mn2+(aq) + +1.51 4 H2O(l) MnO2(s) + 4 H+(aq) + 2 e– → Mn2+(aq) + +1.23 2 H2O(l) MnO4–(aq) + 4 H+(aq) + 3 e– → MnO2(s) + ??? 2 H2O(l)
A current of 1.20 A passed through a solution of a metal nitrate for 153 minutes plates out 3.92 g of the metal. What is the metal?

Which changes will lead to an increase in the theoretical cell potential for a hydrogen-oxygen fuel cell? I. A more efficient catalyst is used at the cathode. II. The temperature is increased from 298 K to 320 K.
Metallic gold will not dissolve in nitric acid alone, but will dissolve in a mixture of nitric and hydrochloric acids. Which is the best explanation for this observation?

options.A: Chloride ion complexes gold(III), stabilizing it as AuCl4–.
options.B: Nitric acid is a stronger oxidant in more acidic solution.
options.C: Nitric and hydrochloric acids react to form NO2Cl, which reacts readily with metallic gold.
options.D: Nitric and hydrochloric acids react to form Cl2, which reacts readily with metallic gold.

text: A concentration cell is set up with a metal M and aqueous solutions of the Mn+ ion. The cell potential at 298 K as a function of the logarithm of the [Mn+] in the anode is graphed below. What may be concluded about the value of n? M(s) | Mn+(aq, variable concentration) || Mn+(aq, 1.00 M) | M(s)

options.D: n cannot be determined from the information given.

text: The first three ionization energies (in kJ mol-1) of four metallic elements are listed below. Which element would form the chloride salt with the lattice energy that is largest in magnitude?
Which element releases the greatest amount of energy upon addition of an electron to a gas-phase atom?
Which species is the strongest oxidant in aqueous solution?
Which gas-phase atom contains the greatest number of unpaired electrons in its ground state?

A clean sample of magnesium metal is irradiated under vacuum with a 1 W laser. If the laser wavelength is 400 nm, nothing happens, but if the wavelength is 300 nm, then electrons with 45.6 kJ mol-1 of energy are ejected from the Mg surface. What happens if a 2 W laser is used instead?

options.A: There is no change at 400 nm, but at 300 nm twice as many electrons are emitted at 45.6 kJ mol-(1).
options.B: There is no change at 400 nm, but at 300 nm, electrons are emitted at 91.2 kJ mol-(1).
options.C: There is no change at 400 nm, but at 300 nm, electrons are emitted at 444 kJ mol-(1).
options.D: At 400 nm, electrons are emitted at 245 kJ mol-1, while at 300 nm, electrons are emitted at 444 kJ mol-(1).

text: Which species has the strongest bond?
Which species has the smallest bond angle?
Which ions are linear? I. N3– II. N2O22-

options.D: Neither I nor II m after April 26, 2020

text: Which is the most stable arrangement of the atoms in space in formamide, HC(O)NH2?
Molecular chlorine, Cl2, has a smaller ionization energy than atomic chlorine, Cl (IE = 1108 kJ mol-1 for Cl2 and 1256 kJ mol-1 for Cl). Which is the best explanation for this difference?

options.A: Cl2 has a covalent bond while Cl does not.
options.B: Cl2 has no unpaired electrons while Cl has one unpaired electron.
options.C: The electron ionized from Cl2 comes from an orbital that has antibonding character.
options.D: The electron ionized from Cl2 comes from an orbital that has d orbital character.

text: How many stereoisomers are possible for the complex ion [Co(NH3)2(CN)2Cl2]–?
Replacing which hydrogens with chlorine would give a chiral molecule?
Which carbon-carbon bond is the shortest?
What is the best description of the geometry at carbon in the transition state of the following reaction? OH– + CH3Br → CH3OH + Br–

options.D: Square pyramidal Page 8 Property of ACS USN

text: Which compound will NOT react readily in aqueous sodium hydroxide solution?

Treatment of acetyl chloride with an equimolar amount of diethylamine at room temperature in diethyl ether gives no more than a 50% yield of N,N-diethylacetamide. Which is the best explanation for this observation?

options.A: Half of the diethylamine is consumed by the neutralization of HCl produced in the reaction.
options.B: Hydrogen bonding between diethylamine molecules makes the reaction second-order in diethylamine.
options.C: Traces of water in the solvent convert at least half of the acetyl chloride into acetic acid.
options.D: Diethylamine is a strong base, but a weak nucleophile.

text: Guanine, one of the bases in DNA, is susceptible to attack by alkylating agents. Which nitrogen in guanine is most prone to alkylation?

options.D: D PLEASE ANSWER THE FOLLOWING FOUR QUESTIONS THANK YOU! text: The amount of time I spend doing experiments in the laboratory per week on average during my chemistry course was/is?

options.D:
more than 2 hours The following questions should be answered using the scale
